utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, do me a favour and take table seven.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You mean the one with my one hundred and eighteen-pound rock-hard stud of a fiancé who’s prone to canker sores and pinkeye?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Nah, I prefer to look at it as the one with my ex-boyfriend and his gorgeous, successful and sophisticated girlfriend, who makes me feel like a toothless Okie.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Do you want me to spill hot soup on her?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, please, you’re not that kind of person.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I know. But if she orders something low-fat I’ll totally give her the full-fat version.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, that’s my water.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: My water. You’re drinking it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Dear Lord! Have you been drinking it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes. It’s my water.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, that’s it then. I’m dead.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Here we go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sorry, do I really need to connect the dots for you? The backwash into this glass is every pathogen that calls your mouth home, sweet home. Not to mention the visitors who arrive on the dancing tongue of your subtropical girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey! That’s my sister and my country you’re talking about. Leonard may have defiled one, but I won’t have you talking smack about the other.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You guys ready to order?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, I’d like a seven-day course of penicillin, some, uh, syrup of ipecac, to induce vomiting, and a mint.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I don’t understand.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He drank from Leonard’s glass.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He drank from Leonard’s glass. Words they’ll be carving into my tombstone.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s actually my napkin.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, this is a nightmare!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: To the bar, to sterilize my mouth with alcohol. Gang way! Dead man walking!

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: All right. Here you go. Two lemonades, one iced tea and a root beer for Priya.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Is it diet?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That’s what you ordered.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Thank you. Hey, have you and Howard started planning your wedding yet?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah. We’re thinking of having it on a cliff overlooking the ocean.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Nothing soothes those pre-wedding jitters like the thought of falling and drowning.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What did your mother say when you told her you were getting married?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: He hasn’t told her yet. He’s waiting for the right time.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I was thinking of weaving it into her eulogy.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Howard, you’ve got to tell your mother.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, have you told your parents you’re dating this short glass of skim milk here?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Uh, that’s different. First of all, we’re not engaged, and second, Indian parents are very protective of their children.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Right, right, whereas Jewish mothers take a casual, la-di-da approach to their sons.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I gargled with tequila and may have swallowed a teeny bit.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You all right?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine. Thank you for asking. I love you so much.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fire demon.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ooh, fire demon. Sheldon’s turning up the heat.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Troll master.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Check it! Howard pulls one out from under the bridge. Nice!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Water nymph.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, she’s got puddles in all the right places.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Could you please play the game without commenting on every card?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sorry. Walking tree.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Last one.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m taking a stroll and I’m sporting wood.

utterance.speaker: Howard (reading a text)
utterance.content: Okay, the Eagle has landed.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Bernadette and my mother are having a get-to-know-you lunch at the Old Town Deli.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, that sounds lovely.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hope so. Of course, if history is any indication, my mother will swallow her whole and spit out her bones like an owl.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Have you met Bernadette’s parents?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You mean Adolf and Eva? Not yet. One goose step at a time.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sheldon, that’s my water.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, dear Lord!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s not your water.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Where’s the mouthwash?

utterance.speaker: Raj (holding it)
utterance.content: Where indeed.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Ma, I’m home! Where are you?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: I’m in the toilet.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So, how’d it go?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
utterance.content: Too soon to say. I’m not done yet.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, I mean lunch, today, with Bernadette.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
utterance.content: Oh! I had a pastrami sandwich. She had eggplant lasagna. Like that’s what a person orders in a Jewish deli.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Besides food, did you get along? Did you talk?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
utterance.content: Oh, sure. Did you know she’s going to school to become a microbiologist?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, she never mentioned it.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
utterance.content: I bet she did and you didn’t listen.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s probably it. So, what do you think? Do you like her? She’s great, huh?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
utterance.content: She’s a lovely girl. Cute as a button.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s good to hear, ’cause I’ve got some news.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
utterance.content: I hope it’s good news, because I’ve got nothing but disappointment in here!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Bernadette and I are getting married. Ma? You too busy bearing down? Ma? Oh, my God, Ma? Ma? Ma? Stand back, I’m gonna break the door down! Son of a bitch! Ma, help!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Haven’t seen you in a while. How’s it going?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, other than waiting out the exponential growth period of the virulent organisms trooping through my microvilli into my circulatory system, hunky-dory. Did I say something amusing?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t know, maybe, I have no idea what you said.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So your mirth is merely a discharge of nervous energy with no semantic content at all?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: My mirth. Classic.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is there a station coming up where I can board your giggling train of thought?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s not a big deal, Sheldon. It’s just, ever since Leonard’s been dating Raj’s sister, I’ve had to keep my distance. I don’t get to hear all your jibber-jabber.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Jibber-jabber? I don’t jibber-jabber.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What are you doing at work these days?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I’m working on time-dependent backgrounds in string theory, specifically quantum field theory in D-dimensional de Sitter space.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Alright, come on, even you have to admit that’s jibber-jabber.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Interesting, do you know where the phrase jibber-jabber comes from?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my God, you’re about to jibber-jabber about jibber-jabber.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Howard and his mother are at the hospital. Come on, we gotta go.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my God! What happened?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know, I just got a text. Come on, hurry.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, let’s go!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: To a hospital? Full of sick people? Oh, I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, well, your friend and his mother are there, we’re going.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can’t.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, don’t tell me you’re afraid of germs.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not all germs. Just the ones that will kill me. It’s the same way I’m not afraid of all steak knives, just the ones that might be plunged in my thorax.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Right, fine. I’ll tell Howard you didn’t come because you’re more concerned about your own well-being than his.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I would think he would know that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, you know what? You are unbelievable. You buy all these superhero T-shirts, but when it’s time for you to step up and do the right thing, you just hide in the laundry room.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine, I’ll go. Just for the record, my Aunt Ruth died in a hospital. She went in to visit my Uncle Roger, caught something and bit the dust a week later. The two of them now share a coffee can on my mother’s mantel.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So I knocked down the bathroom door, picked up my poor unconscious mother, carried her to the car, and drove like a madman to the emergency room.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You’re a real hero, Howard.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, I did what any son would do.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hang on a second, you picked up your mother? Her own legs are barely able to do that.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I was filled with adrenaline. It happens to be how women lift cars off babies.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m saying, it’d be easier to lift a car.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What can I tell you? After I found the courage to put her pants back on, I was unstoppable.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, how is she?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: They’re running tests. I don’t know. It may have been a heart attack or heart-attack-like event.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s the difference?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A heart-attack-like event is an event that’s like a heart attack.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thanks for clearing that up.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Regardless, coronary problems are eminently treatable. What’s more likely going to kill Howard’s mother are the antibiotic-resistant super-bugs festering in every nook and cranny of this hospital.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, you’re not helping.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Disagree.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Go sit over there.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ll sit over there, it looks cleaner.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Is there a history of heart disease in your family?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: My family is the history of heart disease. There’s a cave painting in France of one of my ancestors doing this .

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So it’s probably genetic.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, maybe. Mom also had just gotten some news that might have upset her.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s not important.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Come on, Howard, I’m going to be your wife. You can share anything with me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’d think that. But no.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You told her we were going to get married and she had a heart attack?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You can’t take that personally.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How else is she supposed to take it?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What you’ve got to keep in mind is that ever since my dad left, I’ve been the whole world to my mother. I mean, she’d be threatened by any woman who can give me what she can’t.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You mean sexual intercourse?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, when you say it like that you make it sound creepy.

utterance.speaker: Priya (arriving)
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howard’s mother had a heart attack because I have sex with him and she can’t.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Bernie, wait!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (to Raj)
utterance.content: I’ll give you $1,000 if you’ll drive me home.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Nice of you to come for Howard.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, he’s my friend. It’s what you do.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: I’m sorry, did I miss something?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s just so weird. Howard Wolowitz is my friend. You know, once he tried to stick his tongue down my throat and I broke his nose.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: That’s a little easier to believe than he’s your friend.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, tell me about it.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: You know, my brother had a group of friends like this in India. They dressed up in leotards and goggles and called themselves the New Delhi Power Rangers.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You mean when he was little.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Not as little as you’d want him to be.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, this stuff is horrible. You want to see if we can find the cafeteria and get real coffee?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Sure. We’re going to the cafeteria to get some coffee. You want anything?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m fine. That’s nice that they’re getting along.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Your girlfriend and your ex-girlfriend are hanging out together? Oh, yeah, that can only be good for you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: One of them broke up with you. Do you really want her telling the other one why?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t care. I don’t have anything to hide.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Good, good. Then you have nothing to worry about.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, I do not. You are a mean little man.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’d think it’d be because my parents didn’t love me, but actually they loved me a great deal.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Bernie, it’s not you. She’s just set in her ways.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: How can we be together if the thought of us getting married might kill your mother?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s the circle of life, sweetie. One day our son will marry someone and it will kill you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Howard, I have to go to the bathroom and no one will take me home.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What’s wrong with the bathroom here?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Pneumococcus, streptococcus, staphylococcus and other assorted coccuses.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon, my mother is on her deathbed and my fiancée is grief-stricken over putting her there. I’m not taking you home.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Will you at least go with me to the restroom here, so you can open the door and flush the urinal?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This might be a good time to point out, Howard, that friendship requires a certain give and take. Hold the door!

utterance.speaker: Doctor
utterance.content: Mr. Wolowitz?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Is she okay?

utterance.speaker: Doctor
utterance.content: It wasn’t a heart attack. She’s awake, she’s resting comfortably. We’re still running a few tests.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Can I see her?

utterance.speaker: Doctor
utterance.content: Actually, she said, and I quote, she’d like to see the little Catholic girl first.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Me? Why me?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Jews have been asking that for centuries. There’s no real good answer.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Okay, well, wish me luck.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Don’t worry, you’ll be fine. Let’s just hide Mr. Cross. If it touches her, it burns.

utterance.speaker: Doctor
utterance.content: You brought a Catholic girl home to your mother?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Doctor
utterance.content: Why don’t I write you a prescription for Xanax.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (exiting while the door is open)
utterance.content: Finally. Oh, what fresh hell is this?

utterance.speaker: Doctor
utterance.content: Wait, you can’t leave here, you’ve been exposed.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, I haven’t. It’s all good.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You want to talk about crazy mothers, Leonard’s mom wouldn’t give him any sort of approval growing up.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Oh, the poor thing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It makes him desperate to please women. That’s why the foreplay goes on and on.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: It does, doesn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s like he’s trying to win a prize. A word of advice, don’t doze off. You will never hear the end of it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (through glass door pane)
utterance.content: Help me! Come back! Penny!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: There are a couple of things I did with Penny that might be a little silly, but…

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Every once in a while, before we’d go to bed, I’d put on a little show for her.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What do you mean, a show?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, you know, the way I took my clothes off.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Like, to music?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’d look pretty stupid if there was no music.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So you’d do a striptease?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I wasn’t swinging around a pole.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Good, good.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: There was one time I put body glitter on.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, I don’t think you have to worry about Penny telling my sister that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, she wouldn’t.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Your big problem is me telling her.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You really are a mean little man.

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Oh, God, that’s so true.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, I know, right?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, what took you guys so long?

utterance.speaker: Priya
utterance.content: Oh, we were just chatting.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s nice. What about?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We were just comparing notes about how you are in the sack.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s funny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What if she wasn’t kidding?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It doesn’t matter. I’m the king of foreplay.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, how’d it go?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You’re a putz. You know what that means?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah. Do you?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Your mother just taught it to me. She thinks she got food poisoning from that deli and she just wanted to make sure I was okay.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And are you?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No, because I’m engaged to a putz. You let me believe I was the reason she had a heart attack.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, based on the available evid…

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Shut up! She said I’m a wonderful girl and that you’re lucky to have me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: Bermadette (in a voice like Mrs Wolowitz)
utterance.content: To the toilet! Is that okay with you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Is it just me, or does she sound sexy when she’s angry?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Mountain Elf.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: He takes the elf from off the shelf.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hell Hounds.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hell Hounds. Who let the Satanic dogs out? Who? Who-who?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Colossal Serpent.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I got a colossal serpent right here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Must you?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sorry, I’m just trying to cheer my buddy up. Rotting Zombie. Sheldon’s new Facebook photo.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Zandor, Wizard of the North. Ha! I win.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: If you skip the part about being under a two-week quarantine because you were exposed to a deadly disease, absolutely.
